svg:text.svg:tspan: If a company wants to manufacture a new product, they carry out a .
1)The use of , some and the amount of certain types of
produced by a product over it’s lifetime can be easily . But the effect of some
is to give a to. E.g. it’s difficult to apply a value to the
negative visual effects of plastic bags in the environment compared to paper ones.
So, producing an LCA is an objective method as it takes into account the values
ying out the This means LCAs can be biased.
3), which only show of the impacts of a product on the
environment can also be biased as they can be written to
the claims of a company, in order to give them .
In the exam you may be asked to evaluate the use of different materials for a particular product, using an LCA.
Q1What are the four stages that need to be considered to conduct a life cycle assessment?[4 marks]
You Can Life Cycle Assessments for and
Life Cycle Assessment StagePlastic BagPaper Bag
The compounds needed to make the plastic are extracted from crude oil
by fractional distillation, followed by cracking and then polymerisation.
Waste is reduced as the other fractions of crude oil have other uses.
Pulped timber is processed using lots
of energy. Lots of waste is made.
Can be used for other things as well as shopping, for example bin liners.
Recyclable but not biodegradable and will take Biodegradable, non-toxic and
up space in landﬁll and pollute land.can be recycled.
Life cycle assessments have shown that even though plastic bags , they take less
energy to make and have a longer than paper bags, so may be to the environment.
A looks at every of a product’s life
to assess the it would have on the environment.
1)Extracting needed for a product can the local , e.g. mining
metals. Extraction can also result in pollution due to the amount of energy needed.
2)Raw materials often need to be to extract the desired materials and this often needs
of energy. E.g. extracting metals from ores or fractional distillation of crude oil.
1) products and their packaging can use a lot of resources and can also
cause a lot of , e.g. such as carbon monoxide or hydrogen chloride.
You also need to think about any products and how to of them. The chemical reactions
used to make compounds from their raw materials can produce waste products. Some waste can
be turned into other , reducing the amount that ends up polluting the environment.
This takes up space and land and water,
e.g. if paint washes off a product and gets into rivers.
2) is used to waste to landfill, which
causes to be released into the atmosphere.
1)The use of a product can damage the environment.
streams and rivers causing damage to .
2) a product is used for or it gets is
also a factor — products that need lots of energy to produce
but are used for ages mean in the .
